results.headline: Review: Aliens Drop Anchor in ‘Arrival,’ but What Are Their Intentions?
results.summary_short: In Denis Villeneuve’s film, Amy Adams plays a linguist struggling to understand interplanetary visitors checking in at 12 spots around the globe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Arrival

results.headline: Review: In ‘Elle,’ Isabelle Huppert Subverts the Role of Rape Victim
results.summary_short: Paul Verhoeven’s film is a psychological thriller, a strangely dry-eyed melodrama, a kinky sex farce and a savage comedy of bourgeois manners.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Elle

results.headline: Review: ‘Almost Christmas,’ a Home-for-the-Holidays Comedy
results.summary_short: David E. Talbert’s film is often disarmingly entertaining, with an appealing and talented cast that includes Danny Glover, Gabrielle Union and Mo’Nique.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Almost Christmas

results.headline: Review: ‘Disturbing the Peace’ Profiles Israelis and Palestinians United Against Violence
results.summary_short: Combatants for Peace, a group of individuals including many former military enemies in the Middle East, seeks solutions to the region’s agonized convulsions.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Disturbing the Peace

results.headline: Review: Watch the Road, and the Driver, Too, in ‘The Monster’
results.summary_short: Zoe Kazan plays a mother driving into the night with her daughter (Ella Ballentine) in this chiller written and directed by Bryan Bertino.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Monster

results.headline: Review: ‘National Bird’ Follows Whistle-Blowers in America’s Drone War
results.summary_short: Sonia Kennebeck’s elegantly unsettling documentary explores the United States’ reliance on aerial combat drones and the emotional and collateral damage.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of National Bird

results.headline: Review: ‘The Anthropologist’ Tells a Mother-Daughter Story, With Rising Seawater
results.summary_short: This documentary from the makers of “The Linguists” uses subtle juxtaposition to meditate on change and adaptability.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Anthropologist

results.headline: Review: ‘Asperger’s Are Us’ Delivers Smart, Perplexing Humor
results.summary_short: The quartet of comics in this documentary met at a summer camp for people with Asperger’s syndrome.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Asperger’s Are Us

results.headline: Review: A Pianist Adrift Encounters a Cougar in ‘Dreamland’
results.summary_short: Robert Schwartzman’s understated sex comedy, his first feature, is a bittersweet study of a man who hasn’t yet taken control of his life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dreamland

results.headline: Review: In ‘Iron Moon,’ Poets Who Know What Work Is
results.summary_short: In this documentary, four poets in China work in hard, sometimes dangerous, jobs, while nourishing themselves by writing poems. They are not alone.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Iron Moon

results.headline: Review: ‘Come and Find Me.’ Then Again, Maybe Not.
results.summary_short: Aaron Paul of “Breaking Bad” and Annabelle Wallis star as a couple torn asunder in this thriller, which Zack Whedon wrote and directed.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Come and Find Me

results.headline: Review: In ‘Lazy Eye,’ Yakking Ex-Lovers Reconnect
results.summary_short: After a graphic designer in California invites his ex-boyfriend to spend the weekend, lovemaking and much talk ensue.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lazy Eye

results.headline: Review: ‘U.S.S. Indianapolis,’ a War (Yawn) Catastrophe
results.summary_short: Nicolas Cage stars in the movie, which manages to make one of World War II’s great disasters dull going — even with the shark attacks.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of U.S.S. Indianapolis: Men of Courage

results.headline: Review: ‘Uncle Kent 2,’ How’s Your Tolerance for Hipster Milquetoasts?
results.summary_short: Kent Osborne returns as the starring character in this sequel to the 2011 film “Uncle Kent.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Uncle Kent 2

results.headline: Review: ‘Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk’: Ang Lee’s Super-High-Definition Take on the Iraq War
results.summary_short: “Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk” is Mr. Lee’s film about innocence, adapted from a novel about the gulf that separates modern soldiers from everyone else.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk

results.headline: Review: In ‘Loving,’ They Loved. A Segregated Virginia Did Not Love Them Back.
results.summary_short: Jeff Nichols’s “Loving” is a fictionalization of the story of Mildred and Richard Loving, an interracial couple whose civil rights case went to the Supreme Court.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Loving

results.headline: Review: Tending the Tempest Within in ‘Peter and the Farm’
results.summary_short: Tony Stone’s documentary portrait of an irascible 68-year-old Vermont farmer has a cosmic dimension, evoking the natural world and the big questions of life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Peter and the Farm

results.headline: Review: ‘We Are X’ Explores the Travails and Triumphs of a Rock Band
results.summary_short: This documentary is about the Japanese group X Japan, which, like so many bands around the world, found fame, then fell apart. But this one rose again.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of We Are X

results.headline: Review: ‘The Prison in Twelve Landscapes’ Reveals the Invisible Tentacles of Mass Incarceration
results.summary_short: An unexpectedly moving look at the elements of the confinement industry that hide in plain sight.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Prison in Twelve Landscapes

results.headline: Review: ‘Doctor Strange’ and His Most Excellent Adventure
results.summary_short: This film is so giddily enjoyable and visually transfixing, you might forget that it’s part of Marvel’s strategy for world domination.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Doctor Strange
